intro: Habranthus paxii, commonly known as the silverleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
